raw_text:
Critics back Aviator for Oscars
 
 Martin Scorsese's The Aviator will win best film at the Oscars, according to the UK's leading movie critics.
 
 But several of those surveyed by the BBC News website think the veteran film-maker will lose the best director prize to Clint Eastwood. Most of the critics tipped Jamie Foxx and Hilary Swank to scoop best actor and actress for Ray and Million Dollar Baby respectively. The jury comprised experts and critics from the top UK film publications. The panel also revealed which nominees they would personally prefer to win.
 
 All expect The Aviator to win best film, but many think it will be a close race between Scorsese's Howard Hughes biopic and Eastwood's boxing drama Million Dollar Baby. The other films nominated are wine comedy Sideways, factual drama Finding Neverland, and Ray Charles biopic Ray.
 
 "I'm pretty sure this is the year of The Aviator, though my own choice would be Sideways," said the Observer's Philip French. "Sideways should win but it doesn't have a hope," said Jamie Graham of Total Film, a position shared by Film 2005 presenter Jonathan Ross. "The form going in to the Oscars points to The Aviator, but I liked Million Dollar Baby more," said Tim Dams, news editor of trade weekly Screen International.
 
 Five of the eight critics tipped Scorsese to win best director, with Mr Dams, Heat's Charles Gant and Empire's Angie Errigo plumping for Eastwood. Sideway's Alexander Payne, Ray's Taylor Hackford and British director Mike Leigh - nominated for period drama Vera Drake - are considered outsiders in this category. "Up until recently I could have sworn Scorsese would get it just for being Scorsese," Ms Errigo told the BBC News website. "But I'm beginning to think Eastwood will get it."
 
 "I'd be very happy for Mike Leigh to win, but I don't think he has any chance," said Charles Gant, film editor of Heat. Foxx's portrayal of Ray Charles has already seen him win prizes at the Golden Globes, Baftas and Screen Actors Guild Awards. Mr Dams said this made him "out-and-out favourite" to be named best actor on Oscar night. "Everyone would be incredibly surprised if he didn't win," he said. "If you're a betting man, he's as close as you get to a certainty." "If Paul Giamatti was nominated for Sideways it would be a different game," says Total Film's Jamie Graham. "But Foxx will and should win."
 
 With Vera Drake star Imelda Staunton nominated for best actress alongside Kate Winslet, Britain has a good chance of victory - on paper. Jonathan Ross, for one, will be very happy if Winslet wins for Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. But while Wendy Ide of The Times still thinks Staunton has a chance, Heat's Charles Gant believes her Bafta win will cut little ice with Academy voters. "I'd like Staunton to win, but her chances are not that great," said Mr Gant, who predicted a second Oscar for Hilary Swank.
 
 "I think Swank will win," said Mr French. "Imelda has got as far as she's going to get playing that role." Staunton is also the personal choice of Steven Gaydos, executive editor of industry magazine Variety. But while he tipped Swank to win, he predicted it would be a close contest. "Everything has the ability to flip by one vote and go the other way," he told the BBC News website. "There's not a sense that it's obvious how it's going to go." Meanwhile, thousands of people have voted in a BBC Radio Five Live poll to find the best film never to have won a best picture Oscar. The audience voted overwhelmingly for The Shawshank Redemption, the 1994 Frank Darabont tale of hope and humanity, which received 52% of the online votes and 68% of the text messages. The other two finalists, Citizen Kane and A Matter of Life and Death split the remaining votes roughly equally. This year's Academy Awards will be shown in the UK by Sky Movies 1 at 0130 GMT on Monday.
 
 - Tim Dams, Screen International: Film - The Aviator; director - Clint Eastwood; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Angie Errigo, Empire: Film - The Aviator; director - Clint Eastwood; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Philip French, The Observer: Film - The Aviator; director - Martin Scorsese; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Charles Gant, Heat: Film - The Aviator; director - Clint Eastwood; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Steven Gaydos, Variety: Film - The Aviator; director - Martin Scorsese; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Jamie Graham, Total Film: Film - The Aviator; director - Martin Scorsese; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Wendy Ide, The Times: Film - The Aviator; director - Martin Scorsese; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Imelda Staunton.
 
 - Jonathan Ross, Film 2005: Film - The Aviator; director - Martin Scorsese; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Tim Dams, Screen International: Film - Million Dollar Baby; director - Clint Eastwood; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Angie Errigo, Empire: Film - The Aviator; director - Martin Scorsese; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Philip French, The Observer: Film - Sideways; director - Martin Scorsese; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Imelda Staunton.
 
 - Charles Gant, Heat: Film - Sideways; director - Mike Leigh; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Imelda Staunton.
 
 - Steven Gaydos, Variety: Film - Million Dollar Baby; director - Clint Eastwood; actor - Don Cheadle; actress - Imelda Staunton.
 
 - Jamie Graham, Total Film: Film - Sideways; director - Alexander Payne; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Hilary Swank.
 
 - Wendy Ide, The Times: Film - Sideways; director - Alexander Payne; actor - Don Cheadle; actress - Imelda Staunton.
 
 - Jonathan Ross, Film 2005: Film - Sideways; director - Clint Eastwood; actor - Jamie Foxx; actress - Kate Winslet.
llama3.2:1b: Martin Scorsese's The Aviator will win best film at the Oscars despite several critics tipping Clint Eastwood for best director.
Most experts agreed that Scorsese would be a strong contender, particularly with his Howard Hughes biopic in competition with Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby.
Several critics also tipped Jamie Foxx and Hilary Swank to win in their respective categories, with many considering The Aviator as the front-runner.
llama3.2:3b: UK's leading movie critics predict The Aviator will win best film at the Oscars, but some think it may lose to Million Dollar Baby.
Most expect Jamie Foxx and Hilary Swank to win best actor and actress for Ray and Million Dollar Baby, respectively.
However, some critics favor Clint Eastwood as director and Kate Winslet for Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind.
gemma2:2b: The Aviator is predicted to win best film by most critics.
Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby is considered a close contender.
Jamie Foxx and Hilary Swank are favored for best actor and actress, respectively.
Mike Leigh's Vera Drake is an outsider in the director category.
Sideways received high praise but many believe The Aviator will win.
Imelda Staunton has a good chance of winning best actress despite stiff competition from Hilary Swank.
The Shawshank Redemption topped a BBC Radio Five Live poll for best film to never have won an Oscar.
The Academy Awards will air on Sky Movies 1 on Monday at 0130 GMT.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Several critics favor Martin Scorsese's The Aviator for best film at the Oscars but are wary of Clint Eastwood winning best director and Hilary Swank in the acting categories.
Jamie Foxx, who starred in Ray and Million Dollar Baby, is tipped to win best actor and actress.
Other nominees include Sideways, Finding Neverland, Ray Charles biopic Ray, Vera Drake, and A Matter of Life and Death.
The voting shows that the best film never to have won a best picture Oscar is The Shawshank Redemption, starring Imelda Staunton as a prisoner.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Martin Scorsese's The Aviator will win best film at the Oscars, while Clint Eastwood is a strong contender for best director and star in Million Dollar Baby.
Critics predict Jamie Foxx to be on Oscar's shortlist for both actor categories.
qwen2.5:3b: Critics predict Martin Scorsese's The Aviator will win best film at the Oscars, with Clint Eastwood likely taking best director for Million Dollar Baby.

Predictions vary on individual categories, but most favor The Aviator and Eastwood in directing, Jamie Foxx in lead actor, Hilary Swank in lead actress, Imelda Staunton in supporting actress (for Sideways), and Martin Scorsese's The Aviator overall.
Many also vote for Mike Leigh’s Vera Drake to win best director.
The Shawshank Redemption leads a UK online poll for the best film never to have won an Oscar.

As for the nominees, it seems that although Scorsese's film is highly acclaimed and is a favorite of critics, Eastwood's film has faced criticism since it lacks some of the key features and elements that make it an outstanding work of art.
The film also doesn't have a consistent release schedule.
smollm:1.7b: The Oscars are a prestigious awards ceremony that recognizes excellence in filmmaking.
The nominees for Best Director and Best Actor/Actress are chosen by a panel of industry professionals, including film critics, producers, and other notable filmmakers.
The nominees are typically announced several months before the ceremony takes place.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: The Aviator is expected to win Best Film at the Oscars by Martin Scorsese's Martin Scorsese, despite competition for best director between him and Clint Eastwood, who they both consider strong contenders.
The film is also nominated for its director.
Imelda Staunton is a key actress in Vera Drake's Sideways, which could make her a strong contender.
Other films like Million Dollar Baby are also being nominated, with Hilary Swank and Jamie Foxx receiving high praise for their roles.
Based on votes from various sources, the film's chances of winning vary.
tinyllama:1.1b:
Summary of the UK Oscar predictions by BBC News website writers is as follows:

1.
Martin Scorsese's "The Aviator" will win Best Film at the upcoming UK Oscar ceremony.
Six out of eight critics (including Jamie Graham from Total Film) recommend this film.
Two of those who voted for it were impressed by its biographical story, while others praised its dramatic performances and cinematography.

Actor Jamie Foxx received a "personal choice" of best actor nomination, and critic Jonathan Ross predicted it would receive the award, but noted that the other two finalists, Citizen Kanesim and A Matters of Life and Death, were almost equally popular among viewers.
In terms of nominations for the Best Director category, Clint Eastwood's "The Aviator" is on course to win.
The film also has a good chance of winning in the Best Actor category with Jamie Foxx.
The other nominees for this category are Ray Charles biopics "Ray" and "Million Dolla Baby," which have received mixed reviews from viewers and critics alike.
As for Best Actress, Imelda Staunton is the personal choice of Steven Gaydoes, executive editor of industry magazine Variety.
The other nominees include Hilary Swank in "The Shawshaank Redempton" and Kate Winslet in "A Matters of Life and Death."
As for Best Supporting Actor, Jamie Foxx is receiving a "personal choice," while the two other finalists are Ahmad Balsam and John C. Reilly.
Overall, Martin Scorsese's "The Aviator" has received overwhelming support from critics and viewers alike.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The Aviator is nominated for Best Picture at the Oscars, with many critics predicting it to take the lead over Howard Hughes biopic Ray and Million Dollar Baby.
However, a survey by UK's leading movie critics suggests that veteran film-maker Martin Scorsese's The Aviator may come out on top, especially considering its strong performance among the experts.
phi:2.7b: The text summarization is as follows: Critics predict that Martin Scorsese's film "The Aviator" will win best movie at the Oscars, but several of them think that veteran filmmaker Clint Eastwood may win for his boxing drama "Million Dollar Baby."
Other nominated films include "Sideways," a wine comedy; "Finding Neverland," a factual drama; and "Ray," a biopic about Ray Charles.
Five critics have Scorsese in the running to win best director, but most of them think Eastwood will take it.
Jamie Foxx is tipped to win best actor for his performance in "Million Dollar Baby" while Imelda Staunton is considered a favorite for the Oscar for her role as Vera Drake's mother.
The poll suggests that "The Shawshank Redemption," a film never to have won an Oscars, has a good chance of winning if it wins at all.
